content.html:
Saw an article on how WFH families are having more kids and, yeah, we've rediscovered the age-old principle that having the ability to provide for your family *and* have adults around to parent makes it easier to raise a child.

We shouldn't stop at the nuclear family, though. We should go all the way back to communal hunter-gatherer village living. Adults do their paid remote work in shifts while others tend to the kids, or do domestic work. Way healthier than how most of us live now.
content.value: Saw an article on how WFH families are having more kids and, yeah, we've rediscovered the age-old principle that having the ability to provide for your family *and* have adults around to parent makes it easier to raise a child.We shouldn't stop at the nuclear family, though. We should go all the way back to communal hunter-gatherer village living. Adults do their paid remote work in shifts while others tend to the kids, or do domestic work. Way healthier than how most of us live now.

content.html:
This past week, the co-instructor in my current Intro to Game Design course was talking about "design pillars" in video game design. And I was like: "Oh, this is just @lumpley & @megueyb's PBTA Agendas / Principles / Always Says, but focused on DESIGN rather than PLAY."

So now I'm thinking about designing a post-PBTA game about how to design games.
content.value: This past week, the co-instructor in my current Intro to Game Design course was talking about "design pillars" in video game design. And I was like: "Oh, this is just @lumpley & @megueyb's PBTA Agendas / Principles / Always Says, but focused on DESIGN rather than PLAY."So now I'm thinking about designing a post-PBTA game about how to design games.

content.html:
Fly Bys!

Majestic Yellow-tailed black cockatoo on a low strafing run over us as we were wining on deck in the early Autumn sun. Grace & majesty.

#YellowTailedBlackCockatoo #WildOz #OzBirds #WildlifePhotography #birds #BirdsInFlight
content.value: Fly Bys!Majestic Yellow-tailed black cockatoo on a low strafing run over us as we were wining on deck in the early Autumn sun. Grace & majesty. #YellowTailedBlackCockatoo #WildOz #OzBirds #WildlifePhotography #birds #BirdsInFlight

photo.alt: Capture of the cockatoo with wings at full span head up and look right at the camera. Yellow tail feathers on full display.

content.html: This week's #ProjectWeirdLittleGuy #ScreenshotSaturday update is: Spawn clusters! It's nothing fancy, but it really helps make world generation more believable and fun to explore? It's just a kind of subtable in my spawn/loot table system, but with min and max number of spawns per cluster and a radius. I've also added things like a loading bar and a failed attempt at terrain LOD but they don't quite screenshot as well
content.value: This week's #ProjectWeirdLittleGuy #ScreenshotSaturday update is: Spawn clusters! It's nothing fancy, but it really helps make world generation more believable and fun to explore? It's just a kind of subtable in my spawn/loot table system, but with min and max number of spawns per cluster and a radius. I've also added things like a loading bar and a failed attempt at terrain LOD but they don't quite screenshot as well  😅

photo.alt: A weird little guy explores part of their desert world but stones and bushes appear in clusters rather than spread by pure random distribution.

content.html:
Man I love Valheim but I wish the devs would put absolutely any game design thought at all into any of the systems that aren't straight lifted from other games. There are so many pain points that read as "we didn't think about this beyond using whatever we'd seen elsewhere."

Any time a game is described as "hard core" or "brutal" or "losing is fun" in the marketing and community messaging I feel like it's just code for "there are really obvious shitty pain points in our design and we don't have the skills to fix them."
